main event: On 5th December 1957 in Kokomo, Indiana, a civilian reported sighting an unidentified object with yellow and red lights. The object then hovered, reversed direction, and grouped into one before dropping out of sight. The report also mentioned silhouettes of three large objects, appearing to be 1/4 mile in diameter, with no sound accompanying the sighting.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 10 minutes, giving the witness a significant duration to observe the object.
The object was observed to hover, change direction, and group together with other similar objects before disappearing, suggesting complex and coordinated movement.
The report mentioned the silhouettes of three large objects, indicating the potential presence of multiple unidentified aerial phenomena at the same time.
No sound was reported despite the close proximity of the objects, adding to the mystery of the sighting.
The conclusion provided possibilities such as balloons, aircraft, astronomical, meteors, or unknown phenomena, indicating the difficulty in identifying the object.
sighted object: unidentified object with yellow and red lights
